data.title: The High Crosses of Antrim
data.meta_description: This paper describes the three "high crosses" found in County Antrim and provides, where possible, some background on the church or monastery they are associated with and the saint remembered as the founder or patron of the church or
data.text:
This paper focuses on the High Crosses of County Offaly with photos and descriptions of each cross, and where possible background on the monastic site and monastic founder associated with the site. In addition there is brief information on the history of County Offaly up to about 1200 CE.

This paper explores the High Crosses of County Fermanagh in Northern Ireland. Descriptions of the crosses are provided along with brief background on the site and primary saint, if available.

This paper describes the high crosses of County Monaghan, offering background on the sites and saints and descriptions and photos of the crosses and cross fragments. In addition, the paper begins with a brief history of County Monaghan up to about 1200 CE.

This paper describes the High Crosses of County Down in Northern Ireland. In addition to photos and descriptions of the carving on the crosses, information on the history of the site and the primary saint(s) are provided.

This paper describes the High Crosses of County Kildare with historical background on the county, the monasteries where the crosses are located and the saints associated with these sites.

A brief introduction to the High Crosses of County Armagh in Northern Ireland. The paper includes background on each site, where available, and photos and descriptions of each cross or cross-fragment.

The focus of this paper is on the High Crosses to be found in County Meath. Some background is provided on the sites and the primary saints associated with the founding of the monastery. Photos of the cross are included as well as descriptions of any carving. In addition, some historical background on what is now County Meath is offered up to about 1200.

The High Crosses of County Clare are described along with information about the history of the monastic sites where High Crosses are found. An introduction to the political and ecclesiastical history of the area from about 400-1200 CE is provided as an introduction.

This paper addresses the High Crosses found in County Tyrone in Northern Ireland. These include the Ardboe Cross, the Caledon Cross, the Clogher cross, l the Donaghmore cross, the Errigal Keerogue cross and the Killoan cross-base. Background on the site is provided where possible and descriptions of the crosses. Directions for getting there are offered.

This paper offers a description of the High Crosses of County Louth in the Republic of Ireland. It begins with a brief historical survey of what is now County Louth, with a focus on the time period of the Irish High Crosses. It continues with background on each of the High Cross sites and photos and descriptions of the crosses and cross fragments found there or housed elsewhere.
